verses.text: And thou shalt make an altar \add of\add* shittim wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and the height thereof \add shall be\add* three cubits.
And thou shalt make the horns of it upon the four corners thereof: his horns shall be of the same: and thou shalt overlay it with brass.
And thou shalt make his pans to receive his ashes, and his shovels, and his basons, and his fleshhooks, and his firepans: all the vessels thereof thou shalt make \add of\add* brass.
And thou shalt make for it a grate of network \add of\add* brass; and upon the net shalt thou make four brasen rings in the four corners thereof.
And thou shalt put it under the compass of the altar beneath, that the net may be even to the midst of the altar.
And thou shalt make staves for the altar, staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with brass.
And the staves shall be put into the rings, and the staves shall be upon the two sides of the altar, to bear it.
Hollow with boards shalt thou make it: as it was shewed thee in the mount, so shall they make \add it\add*.
And thou shalt make the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward \add there shall be\add* hangings for the court \add of\add* fine twined linen of an hundred cubits long for one side:
and the twenty pillars thereof and their twenty sockets \add shall be of\add* brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets \add shall be of\add* silver.

And likewise for the north side in length \add there shall be\add* hangings of an hundred \add cubits\add* long, and his twenty pillars and their twenty sockets \add of\add* brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets \add of\add* silver.
And \add for\add* the breadth of the court on the west side \add shall be\add* hangings of fifty cubits: their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
And the breadth of the court on the east side eastward \add shall be\add* fifty cubits.
The hangings of \add one\add* side \add of the gate shall be\add* fifteen cubits: their pillars three, and their sockets three.
And on the other side \add shall be\add* hangings, fifteen \add cubits:\add* their pillars three, and their sockets three.

And for the gate of the court \add shall be\add* a hanging of twenty cubits, \add of\add* blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework: \add and\add* their pillars \add shall be\add* four, and their sockets four.
All the pillars round about the court \add shall be\add* filleted \add with\add* silver; their hooks \add shall be of\add* silver, and their sockets \add of\add* brass.
The length of the court \add shall be\add* an hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty every where, and the height five cubits \add of\add* fine twined linen, and their sockets \add of\add* brass.
All the vessels of the tabernacle in all the service thereof, and all the pins thereof, and all the pins of the court, \add shall be of\add* brass.
And thou shalt command the children of Israel, that they bring thee pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamp to burn always.

In the tabernacle of the congregation without the vail, which \add is\add* before the Testimony, Aaron and his sons shall order it from evening to morning before the \sc Lord\sc*: \add it shall be\add* a statute for ever unto their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.
